sentence.Network_en: The risks to health are impossible to quantify.
sentence.Network_cn: 健康的风险是无法用数量表示的。

sentence.Network_en: The cost of the fire damage is impossible to quantify.
sentence.Network_cn: 这次火灾的损失是无法计算的.

sentence.Network_en: It is difficult to quantify an exact figure as firms are reluctant to declare their losses.
sentence.Network_cn: 由于各家公司都不愿意公布所受的损失，所以很难得出一个精确的数字。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 杜绝“舌尖上的浪费”(1)- 双语新闻 - 21英语网 ... the tip of the iceberg 冰山一角 quantify 量化 diminishing 逐渐减小的.
英语六级考试必备核心词汇3 - 豆丁网 ... qualitative a. 质的；定性的 quantify vt. 确定…的数量 quantitative a. 量的；定量的.
英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(Q) ... quantifier 数量词 quantify 定量 quantitate 测定的数量.
会计英语基础教程 - MBA智库文档 ... public accounting 公共会计 quantify vt. 确定数量 Red Cross 红十字会.

list.abs: unbounded operator 无界算子unbounded quantifier 无界量词unbounded sequence 无界序列
自我量化（Quantified Self），也称作“自我跟踪”（self-tracking）或者“生活数据化骇客”（life hacking），最初由《连线》杂志的编辑 …
bounded quantification 有界量词限制bounded quantifier 有界量词bounded sequence 有界序列
在一阶逻辑中有两个逻辑量词:全称量词(universal quantifier) 和存在量词(existential quantifier) ,它们约束变数,起量化的作用。对(9)可以作两种量化,分别得到(10).

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from medieval Latin quantificare, from Latin quantus 'how much'

entry.tran: 确定…的数量;用数量来表示；量化
entry.def: If you try to quantify something, you try to calculate how much of it there is.

example.ex: It is difficult to quantify an exact figure as firms are reluctant to declare their losses.
example.tran: 由于各家公司都不愿意公布所受的损失，所以很难得出一个精确的数字。

means.word_mean: 2. express as a number or measure or quantity;

stems_affixes.word_buile: quantity[n.量, 数量]+ative表形容词→quantitative数量的
quant多少,数量+ity表名词→n.量, 数量

stems_affixes.value_cn: 量, 额, [物] 量子, 量子论
stems_affixes.word_buile: quant多少,数量+um→n.量, 额, [物] 量子, 量子论
quant多少,数量+ify……化→v.确定数量 v.量化

Sentence.sentence: The urge to quantify is embedded in our society.

Trying to quantify or measure the impact of women in politics is hard because in very few countries have there been enough women in politics to make a difference,"says Anne-Marie Goetz, peace and security adviser for U.N. Women.
